alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:59PM EST until January 29 at 4:25PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek at Rapids. * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage, lowland flooding of farm areas along Tonawanda Creek between Rapids and the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding may impact Fletcher, Koepsel, Burdick, Kirby, and Tonawanda Creek Roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 13.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 02/12/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1100 AM EST.
